title: People of the Pandemic
subtitle: A global pandemic has arrived in your backyard.

landing.explanation1: You're in the first few days of a new viral spread. This virus can be transmitted before symptoms appear, and it has the potential to spread throughout the entire community—unless you take action now through physical distancing. The coming weeks are crucial for saving thousands of lives.
landing.explanation2: But you can’t do this alone! It’ll take the cooperation of the entire community to slow the spread of this disease. Together, you’ll have to find ways to meet your individual needs while limiting your outings as much as possible.
landing.explanation3: You’ll play alongside 19 other real people.
landing.explanation4: These 19 people have played before you, and have made the weekly decisions you are about to.  Their decisions and yours together will determine how frequently people in your community leave their homes each week, for the duration of 8 weeks.
landing.explanation5: Your collective decisions will determine how many lives are lost or saved.
landing.instruction1: To start, enter your zip code* or choose a community size.
landing.instruction2: We’ll pull real data to set up the game with your community’s actual population and number of available hospital beds.
landing.zipCodeDisclaimer: <sup>*unfortunately, we currently only support US zip codes.</sup>

decide.rest: Here's what the rest of your community decided to do:
decide.businessAsUsual:
Your local government is now considering going back to business as usual. Would you like to see what the next four weeks might look like if everyone in your community went out every day of the week again*?

*you won't have to make any more decisions.

end.closerLook: Here's a closer look at the numbers:
end.numbers: Your community had {total} total cases, including {deaths} deaths. However, this is {avoided} less cases than if your community had gone on with business as usual, and you were able to collectively save {saved} lives.
end.together: You may have felt that your decisions had little influence over the weeks—but in fact, your community was able to achieve these numbers precisely because of your decisions, compounded by the decision of the 19 others in your team:
end.future: In turn, future players will be helped by the decisions you made today.
end.influence: This is reflected in the real world: when everyone chooses to stay home as much as possible, the most infections are avoided. Slower infection rates mean that hospitals and first responders can better help the sickest members of our community.
end.share: So, take a moment to share this game with your friends, family, and neighbors and work to flatten the curve, together.

footnotes.fullDisclaimer:
While we tried our best to get our numbers as close to COVID-19 numbers as possible, the COVID-19 numbers are still too new and moving too quickly. Thus we want to emphasize that we're modeling a virus, not the virus.

For more details, please see our full methodology.
